item.description:
We went to this event last year and it was a nice way to spend an evening! There were about 15 drummers, a few people dancing around the campfire, tiki torches, kids in facepaint, and families picnicking. Bring a lawn chair or a blanket to sit on and some food to snack on. Or bring your drum, too!

" Celebrate a spring evening with drumming and dancing around a fire! We'll dance and play to a mix of traditional African rhythms and organized rhythm jams. You're welcome to bring your own hand drums and percussion, or simply come to dance and enjoy.

This event is about listening to each other, co-creating music and dancing our spirit. It's in a beautiful location, under the nearly full moon, a few days before summer solstice. While many of us have studied drumming for years, others are new to the drum. We all can learn from each other as we create magical, danceable rhythms.

The event is free and open to all ages and experience levels. Bring music from your heart and a sharing spirit. Please bring water to drink and snacks if you like. No alcohol! If you like to play while sitting, consider bringing a lightweight chair (we're a 4 minute walk from parking.)"

 

Additional details and directions at:

http://www.actondrumdance.org/node/16
item.how_to_find_us: Meet by the campfire on he hill overlooking the pond
item.name: Acton Drum and Dance Evening
